intro: Pembertonia, commonly known as the white gum or white box, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Myrtaceae. It is native to Australia and consists of several species, many of which are shrubs or small trees. The plants are characterized by their aromatic leaves and showy, white or pale yellow flowers that appear in clusters. They typically grow in dry, sandy soils and are adapted to the harsh conditions of the Australian landscape. Pembertonia species are valued for their ornamental appeal and ecological importance in native habitats.
